metadata.Title: CVE-2022-1734 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
A flaw in Linux Kernel found in nfcmrvl_nci_unregister_dev() indrivers/nfc/nfcmrvl/main.c can lead to use after free both read or writewhen non synchronized between cleanup routine and firmware downloadroutine.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-1734` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1082-fips - 4.4.0-1082.89
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1082-fips - 4.4.0-1082.89
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-1082-fips - 4.4.0-1082.89
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.4.0-1082-fips - 4.4.0-1082.89
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
